1.definition: To stick to a surface or substance [or] follow a practice or belief

2.definition: To regard as probable [or] to expect or predict

3.definition: A special quality of a person, group, or thing

4.definition: To write or create [or] to constitute or make up

5.definition: Expressing criticism or disapproval [or] relating to the careful judgements of critics

6.definition: To make an official decision, based on evidence or facts [or] to be the cause or reason for something

7.definition: To recognize what makes someone or something different [or] to make someone or something appear different

8.definition: To occupy or attract someone's interest or attention [or] to participate in something

9.definition: Giving or reflecting a strong light [or] very obvious or conspicuous

10.definition: A supposition or proposed explanation based on limited evidence

12.definition: Unavoidable [or] a situation that is unavoidable (noun usage)

13.definition: The ability to understand something before using conscious reasoning [] something that one knows before thinking about it

14.definition: to show or prove to be right [or] to be a good reason for doing something

15.definition: To intentionally leave something or someone out [or] to leave something undone

16.definition: To come before in time, order, or position

18.definition: Appropriate to the matter at hand

19.definition: of small value or importance [or] a person only concerned with unimportant things

20.definition: Not changing in form or character, or similar in form or character to other things
